attributes.action: A SCOTTISH VOTE FOR INDEPENDENCE MEANS A FULL DIVORCE FROM ENGLAND
attributes.additional_details: If the Scotts vote for independence from the Union then the English insist in the cutting of all English investment in Scotland, the re-patriation of all Scotts currently working in England (unless they take an English citizen test and hold an English passport), the total separation of English defence forces and no Scottish presence in either the Commons or the Lords. The Scots understand that a vote for independence means divorce with no alimony and not convenient separation
